revised_title: Spectra of Carbon Compounds: Nitrocarbon and Hydrocarbon Bands
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the spectra of carbon compounds, specifically focusing on nitrocarbon and hydrocarbon bands. They discovered that certain bands in the spectrum are associated with the presence of nitrogen and carbon in chemical union. The authors also studied the cyanogen spectrum and found that it remains consistent across various conditions, such as different gases and temperatures. Their findings contribute to the understanding of the chemical and physical properties of carbon compounds.
